title: Trump to Use $130 Million Donation to Help Pay Troops

title: U.S. Deploys Aircraft Carrier to Latin America as Drug Operation Expands
summary: The Trump administration has acknowledged 10 strikes on suspected drug-smuggling boats from South America, which have killed 43 people.

title: Republicans Who Have Rarely Opposed Trump Raise Questions About His Drug War
summary: The president said he wouldn’t seek congressional approval for his expanding military offensive against cartels, but some in his party believe Congress should weigh in.

summary: The United States Treasury Department accused President Gustavo Petro of allowing drug trafficking to flourish.

title: Justice Department Will Monitor Elections in California and New Jersey
summary: The Trump administration said that monitors will watch polling in two states, led by Democrats, where key races or issues are on the ballot.

title: Bannon Claims ‘There Is a Plan’ for Trump to Run for a Third Term
summary: The claim comes after months of President Trump toying with the idea, insisting that he is “not joking” about defying a constitutionally-mandated term limit.

title: Trump Administration Plans a Shake-Up at ICE to Speed Deportations
summary: The preliminary plan stems from frustration over the pace of the deportations, which are lagging behind President Trump’s demands.

title: Trump Leaves Behind a Reeling Washington to Chase a Deal With China

title: Asia, Caught in the Middle, Faces Trump and Xi’s Tug of War
summary: President Trump’s visit shows how the United States and China are vying for influence in Asia over trade, technology and the fate of Taiwan.

title: Trump’s Asia Tour: Deals, Diplomacy and a Meeting With Xi
summary: From Kuala Lumpur to Gyeongju, President Trump is casting himself as a deal-maker and peace negotiator, while a wary region looks for tariff relief and steadier ties.

title: Amid the Rubble of the East Wing, Lessons in How Trump Exercises Power
summary: From the first day of his second term, President Trump has taken an ends-justify-the-means approach to his presidency.

title: The White House’s Movie Theater Is Among the East Wing Rubble
summary: Nixon watched “Patton” there. Obama hosted the “Lincoln” cast. Built in 1942, the White House’s private movie theater offered refuge and entertainment.

title: U.S. Details How Mob and Ex-NBA Players Lured High Rollers Into Poker Trap
summary: A Manhattan apartment was at the center of a Mafia-run ring that used former N.B.A. players as bait and technology to read cards, prosecutors say.

title: Pumpkin Spice Lattes, a Favorite U.S. Fall Drink, Divide Europe
summary: One of America’s favorite fall drinks shows up in Brussels and Antwerp, but rarely in Paris and Rome. It has yet to reach the ubiquity — or the sugar content — of its stateside counterpart.

title: Trump’s Son Is Poised to Profit From Pentagon Drone Proposal
summary: A small company that has been manufacturing motors domestically for only a few weeks and has Donald Trump Jr. as an adviser won a parts order from the Army.

title: Trump and Canada’s Trade Spat Spotlights Doug Ford, the Ontario Premier
summary: Doug Ford has built a reputation for picking fights with President Trump and getting under his skin with publicity-grabbing moves as U.S. tariffs have harmed Ontario’s economy.

title: Trump Decries Anti-Tariff Ad From Ontario, Canada, That Faithfully Quotes Reagan Speech
summary: The anti-tariff ad, which President Trump pointed to in cutting off trade talks with Canada, uses several sound bites from an April 1987 speech, though not in the order President Ronald Reagan said them.

title: Sirikit, Glamorous Former Queen of Thailand Who Wielded Power, Dies at 93
summary: As the wife of King Bhumibol Adulyadej, she traveled the world charming government leaders and the public.

title: In Fight Against Malaria, an Unexpected — and Snuggly — Shield

title: A Missing Picasso Is Found, and a Small Spanish Town Loses Its Air of Mystery
summary: For a brief moment, the puzzle of what had happened to Pablo Picasso’s “Still Life With Guitar” infected Deifontes with caper fever.

title: DNA Identifies 2 Bacterial Killers That Stalked Napoleon’s Army
summary: Genetic material pulled from 13 teeth found in a grave in Lithuania revealed infectious diseases that felled the French emperor’s troops as they withdrew from Russia.
